clinical_study.brief_title: Health Impact Study of Aquatabs in Tamale, Ghana
clinical_study.official_title: Health Impact Study of a Water Treatment Tablet, Aquatabs, in Tamale, Ghana

lead_sponsor.agency: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

collaborator.agency: Emory University Center for Global Safe Water
University for Development Studies, Tamale, Ghana

clinical_study.source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study to determine whether Aquatabs, a water treatment tablet, reduces diarrheal diseases in a peri-urban population of Tamale, Ghana.

primary_outcome.measure: Measure the impact of Aquatabs on diarrhea among persons in households in Tamale, Ghana.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the microbiological quality of household water among persons living in Tamale, Ghana.

arm_group.description: Placebo group does not receive Aquatabs.

intervention.description: Intervention arm receives NaDCC tablets to use for to disinfect their household water for use for 20L of water. Ideally, disinfection occurs every day.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Households with at least one child under 5 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
